alert.note: Alert for Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 7:33PM CDT until May 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN KNOX COUNTY... At 733 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northeast of Knox City, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported golf ball hail in Benjamin. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Munday, Knox City, Benjamin, Goree, Vera, and Rhineland. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. This is a dangerous storm, producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
